text: This article is a list of hereditary peers who are or have been members of the House of Lords by virtue of a life peerage. == List of hereditary peers with life peerages == {| class="wikitable" |+Key |1 | Hereditary peers of first creation living at the time the House of Lords Act 1999 came into force. |- |2 | Hereditary peers who had served as Leader of the House of Lords living at the time the House of Lords Act 1999 came into force. |- |3 | Suo jure hereditary peeress not otherwise able to enter the House before the Peerage Act 1963. |} {|class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |+Hereditary peers with life peerages ! scope="col" | Hereditary peer ! scope="col" | Life title ! colspan="2" scope="col" | Affiliation ! scope="col" | Hereditary title inherited/created ! scope="col" | Life title created ! scope="col" | Died/Left House ! class="unsortable" scope="col" | Ref. |- ! scope="row" | George Jellicoe, 2nd Earl Jellicoe2 | Baron Jellicoe of Southampton | style="background-color: " | | Conservative | 1935 | 1999 | 2007 | |- ! scope="row" |Peter Carington, 6th Baron Carrington2 | Baron Carington of Upton | style="background-color: " | | Conservative | 1940 | 1999 | 2018 | |- ! scope="row" |Frank Pakenham, 7th Earl of Longford, 1st Baron Pakenham1 2 | Baron Pakenham of Cowley | style="background-color: " | | Labour | 1945 | 1999 | 2001 | |- ! scope="row" |Malcolm Shepherd, 2nd Baron Shepherd2 | Baron Shepherd of Spalding | style="background-color: " | | Labour | 1954 | 1999 | 2001 | |- ! scope="row" | John Ganzoni, 2nd Baron Belstead2 | Baron Ganzoni | style="background-color: " | | Conservative | 1958 | 1999 | 2005 | |- ! scope="row" |Irene Curzon, 2nd Baroness Ravensdale3 | Baroness Ravensdale of Kedleston | style="background-color: " | | Crossbencher | 1925 | 1958 | 1966 | |- ! scope="row" |Antony Charles Robert Armstrong-Jones, 1st Earl of Snowdon1 | Baron Armstrong-Jones | style="background-color: " | | Crossbencher | 1961 | 1999 | 2016 | |- ! scope="row" |Toby Low, 1st Baron Aldington1 | Baron Low | style="background-color: " | | Conservative | 1962 | 1999 | 2000 | |- ! scope="row" | Frederick Erroll, 1st Baron Erroll of Hale1 | Baron Errol of Kilmun | style="background-color: " | | Conservative | 1964 | 1999 | 2000 | |- ! scope="row" |David Hennessy, 3rd Baron Windlesham2 | Baron Hennessy | style="background-color: " | | Conservative | 1968 | 1999 | 2010 | |- ! scope="row" | Robert Lindsay, 29th Earl of Crawford and 12th Earl of Balcarres | Baron Balniel | style="background-color: " | | Conservative | 1975 (Dec) | 1975 (Jan) | 2019 | |- ! scope="row" |Julian Grenfell, 3rd Baron Grenfell | Baron Grenfell of Kilvey | style="background-color: " | | Labour | 1976 | 2000 | 2014 | https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/ld201415/ldhansrd/text/141013-0001.htm Lords Hansard for 13 October 2014 |- ! scope="row" |Robert Gascoyne-Cecil, 7th Marquess of Salisbury2 | Baron Gascoyne-Cecil | style="background-color: " | | Conservative | 1992 | 1999 | 2017 | |- ! scope="row" |Anthony Gueterbock, 18th Baron Berkeley | Baron Gueterbock | style="background-color: " | | Labour | 1992 | 2000 | | |- ! scope="row" | Michael Kerr, 13th Marquess of Lothian | Baron Kerr of Monteviot | style="background-color: " | | Conservative | 2004 | 2010 | | |- ! scope="row" | Douglas Hogg, 3rd Viscount Hailsham | Baron Hailsham of Kettlethorpe | style="background-color: " | | Conservative | 2001 | 2015 | | |} == List of life peers who have disclaimed hereditary peerage == {|class="wikitable plainrowheaders sortable" |+Life peers with disclaimed hereditary peerages ! title: List of hereditary peers in the House of Lords by virtue of a life peerage
